channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache POI
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache POI

item.title: CVE-2017-5644|2024-08-05T15:11:47.262Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20poi
item.description: Apache POI in versions prior to release 3.15 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a specially crafted OOXML file, aka an XML Entity Expansion (XEE) attack.

item.title: CVE-2017-12626|2024-08-05T18:43:56.421Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20poi
item.description: Apache POI in versions prior to release 3.17 are vulnerable to Denial of Service Attacks: 1) Infinite Loops while parsing crafted WMF, EMF, MSG and macros (POI bugs 61338 and 61294), and 2) Out of Memory Exceptions while parsing crafted DOC, PPT and XLS (POI bugs 52372 and 61295).
